newsitem.title: FRANCE: CGIP plans no public offer for Cerus,Valeo.
newsitem.headline: CGIP plans no public offer for Cerus,Valeo.

text.p: French company CGIP has no plan to launch a public offer for Cerus or Valeo, a spokeswoman for CGIP said on Tuesday.
"We deny any plan for a public offer for Cerus or Valeo," the spokeswoman told Reuters.
French newspapers reported CGIP was in advanced negotiations to buy out Cerus, Italian industrial Carlo De Benedetti's French holding company, and its 28 percent stake in car parts supplier Valeo.
She said the company was preparing to issue a statement.
"After reading the reports recently published in newspapers, CGIP denies the intentions attributed to it concerning a public offer on Cerus or Valeo," the company said in a one-sentence statement.
